current_country=(country)

Set the current country code (ISO 3166 country code in uppercase letters) Usage: Globalite.current_country = ‘US’ or Globalite.current_country = :fr Will store the current country code if supported Will try to automatically find the language for your country If the country isn‘t unknown from the system, the country will be set as :*

[Source]

     # File lib/globalite/l10n.rb, line 78
 78:     def current_country=(country)
 79:       load_localization! if defined? RAILS_ENV && RAILS_ENV == 'development'
 80:       country = country.to_s.upcase.to_sym if country.class == Symbol
 81:       country = country.upcase.to_sym if country.class == String && !country.empty?
 82: 
 83:       if @@locales.include?("#{current_language}-#{country}".to_sym)
 84:         @@current_country = country
 85:       elsif locales.each {|locale| locale =~ /[a-z][a-z]-#{country.to_s}/ }
 86:         locales.each do |key| 
 87:           if key.to_s.include?(country.to_s)  
 88:             @new_language = key.to_s.split('-')[0].downcase.to_sym
 89:           end
 90:         end
 91:         if @new_language
 92:           @@current_language = @new_language 
 93:           @@current_country = country 
 94:         end
 95:       else  
 96:         @@current_country = :*
 97:       end
 98:       Locale.update_session_locale
 99:       @@current_country
100:     end

current_language=(language)

Set the current language ( ISO 639-1 language code in lowercase letters) Usage: Globalite.current_language = ‘fr’ or Globalite.current_language = :Fr Will save the current language code if available, otherwise nada, switching back to the previous language

load_localization!()

Loads ALL the UI localization in memory, I might want to refactor this later on. (can be hard on the memory if you load 25 languages with 900 strings in each)

[Source]

     # File lib/globalite/l10n.rb, line 154
154:     def load_localization!
155:       reset_l10n_data
156:       
157:       # Load the rails localization
158:       if rails_localization_files
159:         rails_localization_files.each do |file|
160:           lang = File.basename(file, '.*')[0,2].downcase.to_sym
161:           # if a country is defined
162:           if File.basename(file, '.*')[3,5]
163:             country = File.basename(file, '.*')[3,5].upcase.to_sym
164:             if locales.include?("#{lang}-#{country}".to_sym)
165:               @@locales["#{lang}-#{country}".to_sym].merge(YAML.load_file(file).symbolize_keys)
166:             else
167:               @@locales["#{lang}-#{country}".to_sym] = YAML.load_file(file).symbolize_keys
168:             end
169:             @@languages << lang unless @@languages.include? lang
170:           else
171:             @@languages << lang unless @@languages.include? lang 
172:             @f_locale = "#{lang}-*".to_sym
173:             @@locales[@f_locale] = @@locales[@f_locale].merge(YAML.load_file(file).symbolize_keys) if locales.include?(@f_locale)
174:             @@locales[@f_locale] = YAML.load_file(file).symbolize_keys unless locales.include?(@f_locale)
175:           end
176:         end
177:       end
178:       
179:       # Load the UI localization
180:       if ui_localization_files
181:         ui_localization_files.each do |file| 
182:           lang = File.basename(file, '.*')[0,2].downcase.to_sym
183:           if File.basename(file, '.*')[3,5]
184:             country = File.basename(file, '.*')[3,5].upcase.to_sym
185:           else
186:             country = '*'.to_sym
187:           end
188:           @@languages << lang unless @@languages.include? lang
189:           @@countries <<  country if ( country != :* && !@@countries.include?(country) )
190:           @file_locale = "#{lang}-#{country}".to_sym
191:           if locales.include?(@file_locale)
192:             @@locales[@file_locale] = @@locales[@file_locale].merge(YAML.load_file(file).symbolize_keys)
193:           else  
194:             @@locales[@file_locale] = YAML.load_file(file).symbolize_keys
195:           end
196:         end
197:       end
198:       localize_rails
199:       # Return the path of the localization files
200:        return "#{ui_localization_files} | #{rails_localization_files}".to_s
201:     end
